Specimen Type: Nasal swabs, wound swabs, sputum, urine, or other sterile-site specimens
Purpose: To detect and report the presence of Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) in clinical specimens to aid in infection treatment and control.
Container: Sterile swab transport tube or sterile leak-proof container appropriate to specimen type
Equipment: MRSA selective agar (e.g., CHROMagar MRSA), blood agar plates, Mueller-Hinton agar with oxacillin or cefoxitin discs, incubator (35-37 Â°C), PCR assay kit (optional for molecular confirmation)
